metadata.title: CVE-2013-1580 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The dissect_cmstatus_tlv function in plugins/docsis/packet-cmstatus.c inthe DOCSIS CM-STATUS dissector in Wireshark 1.6.x before 1.6.13 and 1.8.xbefore 1.8.5 uses an incorrect data type for a position variable, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via amalformed packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
